subject: Politics
title: Elections as Accountability
description: Learn Elections as Accountability in one minute.

hook.text: Elections exist to fire bad leaders. If you can't remove someone from power, you don't have democracy.

buildup.text: Electoral accountability means voters reward good performance and punish failure at the ballot box.

discovery.text: Studies show voters punish economic downturns more than they reward growth. Fear outweighs gratitude.

twist.text: Incumbents win most races anyway. Name recognition, funding, and gerrymandering give them huge advantages.

climax.text: Without real competition, elections become rituals. Accountability needs genuine choices, not just ballots.

punchline.text: Elections without real choices are just theater with voting booths.

quiz.question: Why do incumbents have an advantage in elections?
options: Name recognition, funding advantages, and gerrymandering
Voters always prefer experience over change
